property.name: text
property.value: Test the loopback port of the Serial accessor with ints.

property.name: text
property.value:
Use the loopback port of the Serial accessor with numbers.
Note that we produce one less output than input.
Stop if we get invalid data. Hopefully the invalid data occurs before the last received data.

property.name: runCommand
property.value: node ../../../node_modules/@accessors-hosts/node/nodeHostInvoke.js net/test/auto/@modelName@

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor sends and/or receives data from a serial port on the host. The accessor lists all the serial ports that it finds as options. Whenever an input is received on the toSend input, the data on that input is sent to the serial port. Whenever data is received from the serial port, the data is produced on the received output. When wrapup() is invoked, this accessor closes the serial port.

The send and receive types can be any of those supported by the host. The list of supported types will be provided as options for the sendType and receiveType parameters. For the Nashorn host, these include at least 'string', 'number', 'JSON', and a variety of numeric types. The type 'number' is equivalent to 'double'.

The data chunks sent on the received output depend on the receiveType parameter. Each output will be of the specified type. Note that if receivedType is 'string' or 'JSON' then the output is produced only after a null byte is received on the serial port. If the type is 'JSON', then this accessor will attempt to parse the JSON. If parsing fails, then the raw byte array will be sent to the invalid output port.

When type conversions are needed, e.g. when you send a double with sendType set to int, or an int with sendType set to byte, then a "primitive narrowing conversion" will be applied, as specified here: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.3 .

For numeric types, you can also send an array with a single call to this.send(). The elements of the array will be sent in sequence.

Accessors that extend this one can override the toSendInputHandler function to customize what is sent.

This accessor requires the 'serial' module.

See https://accessors.org/wiki/VersionCurrent/Serial.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee, Beth Osyk, Chadlia Jerad, Victor Nouvellet

property.name: toSend (port)
property.value: The data to be sent over the serial port.

property.name: received (port)
property.value: The data received from the serial port converted to the specified type.

property.name: invalid (port)
property.value: Byte arrays that fail to parse in JSON.

property.name: port (parameter)
property.value: The port on the host to connect to. This defaults to the last (most recently added, presumably) serial port in the list of serial ports on the host.

property.name: receiveType (parameter)
property.value: See above.

property.name: sendType (parameter)
property.value: See above.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval between outputs in milliseconds.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Accessor that stops execution of the enclosing swarmlet when it receives an input with value true. It does this by identifying the top-level enclosing composite accessor and invoking wrapup on it.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee (eal@eecs.berkeley.edu)

property.name: stop (port)
property.value: A signal with value true to stop the swarmlet.
